Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Bernie Sanders' health care plan does not propose raising the tax rate to 52% on incomes over $29,000. Instead, it proposes a 4% income-based premium on earnings over $29,000 and a 52% tax rate on earnings over $10 million.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the tax rate proposed by Bernie Sanders' health care plan, stating it as 52% for incomes over $29,000, while the actual proposal is a 4% income-based premium.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the assertion that Bernie Sanders' health care plan proposes a 52% tax rate on incomes over $29,000.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that Bernie Sanders said during a debate that he would raise taxes to 52% on anyone making over $29,000 a year, which is not true.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is provided by Sanders himself, who stated that any tax increase for low-wage workers would be offset by lower health care costs.
